reviewText: There is a special empathy around Mr. Golson. I think it begins with his lyrical compositions more than with his master command in his sax playing and more than with simpathetic look. Happens that Mr. Golson is also a unique player. Also happens that he looks so gentle a man.Golson counts on his long time trumpet player associate, another master, Mr. Art Farmer. Seems like they were born together. Rhythm section is also brilliant, featuring Geoff Keezer at the piano, as brilliant as young.Repertoire includes the title song 'Whisper Not', one of the great jazz standards composed by Golson.Also Jon Hendricks shows his artistry in some Golson material as great as ever.Features an uncommon image and color quality. Recorded in Europe.
summary: Composer and master saxophonist in action
Title: BENNY GOLSON: The Whisper Not Tour

reviewText: One hour of Golson with Art Farmer, Curtis Fuller, Jon Hendricks, etc. at  the 1996 Berlin Jazz Festival, plus another version of "Whisper Not" from the Skopje Festival that same year, as well as three audio-only tracks from three different Golson CDs.  The surprise for some may be the exceptional playing of the then very young and just emerging pianist Geoff Keezer, as attested to by the admiring glances of his elders during his solos.  You can't go wrong with this DVD.
Title: BENNY GOLSON: The Whisper Not Tour

reviewText: Benny Golson: The Whisper Not Tour is a DVD of the last video recorded that reunited jazz legends Benny Golson, Art Farmer, and Curtis Fuller, along with special guest Jon Hendricks. A multiple-camera video production showcasing Golson's compositional and performance talents, Benny Golson: The Whisper Not Tour includes some of Golson's most beloved classics in non-standard form, enhanced by Hendricks' dulcet voice. The performed songs include "Are You Real?", "Out of the Past", "Blues March", "I Remember Clifford", and "Whisper Not." Bonus DVD features include a Benny Golson biography and gallery, as well as bonus musical and concert performance footage. A treat for jazz enthusiasts.
summary: A DVD of the last video recorded that reunited jazz legends Benny Golson, Art Farmer, and Curtis Fuller
Title: BENNY GOLSON: The Whisper Not Tour

reviewText: This DVD is what a good concert should be, It is of greatquality, both visual and audio. If you are familiar withjazz, you know these guys are top shelf musicians thatcreated a sound in the 50s and 60s, that still soundsmodern. This one, you will treasure.
summary: This one is a must have!
Title: BENNY GOLSON: The Whisper Not Tour

reviewText: Listening to great jazz is one thing, watching is another dimension. Good to see jazz use young and older talents.
Title: BENNY GOLSON: The Whisper Not Tour
